channel.title: Play Now Button When Hovering Over Agility Skill [Solved]
channel.description:
Hello again, I have another issue... Once again, I'm still using DeathlyPvpz V4.1. This isn't a huge issue, but it bothers the hell out of me! When ever you hover your mouse over the agility skill to see how much EXP you have in it, the two sprites of the "Play Now" button overlay the EXP box... Here's a picture of what it looks like.
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/2a9zl20.png[/img]
Is this server or client sided? I'm assuming it's client sided. I found this issue similar to another post when looking for a fix for this bug, and someone said to edit the tooltips in RSInterface.java. (The forum post I came across: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=522768.0) Though I don't think this problem has to do with the tooltips (although, I could very well be wrong), I think the fix can be found somewhere in RSInterface.java. With that said, I have included a link to my RSInterface.java on Pastebin. - http://pastebin.com/rrB68sWZ I don't know if this will help at all, but I've also included a link to my cache. - https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/54429218/ProjectCridCache.zip Please remember that absolutely any help is appreciated VERY much. Thank you for trying to help me.
P.S. If you for any reason need to look at the rest of the Deathlypvpz files server or client sided, you can download them at the official release thread. - https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,633225.0.html Thanks again!

item.title: Play Now Button When Hovering Over Agility Skill [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @iRobertTM iRobertTM
item.description:
@iRobertTM wrote:

Vain_:

the line ids are clashing for the interfaces, due to it being custom. change one of their ids.

I did it!!! I fixed it, but the only problem is now the button doesn’t close the interface that it’s on! How do I make it close the interface?? THANK YOU SO MUCH!

Read full topic

item.title: Play Now Button When Hovering Over Agility Skill [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @iRobertTM iRobertTM
item.description:
@iRobertTM wrote:

I did do a search in my client for “PLAYNOW”, this was the results.

2lm85rl.jpg761×507

That’s the code to make this interface appear.

Does it have a certain id assigned to it that I could find and search? Are you sure it’s not server sided? Thank you for helping me. :]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[code=java] public static void skillInterface(TextDrawingArea[] wid) {
RSInterface rsinterface = addTabInterface(3917);
int index = 0;
skillInterface(19746, 255);
skillInterface(19749, 52);
addText(29801, “”, wid, 0, 0xFFEE33); //Summoning
addText(29800, “”, wid, 0, 0xFFEE33); //Hunter

            addButton(19747, 51, 27700, "Skill/Skill", 62, 32, "View @lre@Hunter @whi@Guide", 1);
            addButton(19748, 50, 27701, "Skill/Skill", 62, 32, "@lre@Dismiss Summoning Familiar@whi@", 1);
           
            addText(13984, "Total", wid, 0, 0xFFEE33);
            addText(3985, "", wid, 0, 0xFFEE33);
            addText(13983, "", wid, 0, 0xFFEE33, true, true);
            for(int k = 0; k < boxIds.length; k++) {
                    skillInterface(boxIds[k], 256);
            }

// RSInterface rsinterface = addTabInterface(3917);
rsinterface.children = new int[63]; rsinterface.childX = new int[63]; rsinterface.childY = new int[63];
rsinterface.children[0] = 3918; rsinterface.childX[0] = 0; rsinterface.childY[0] = 0;

rsinterface.children[50] = 4070; rsinterface.childX[50] = 20; rsinterface.childY[50] = 180;
rsinterface.children[51] = 8670; rsinterface.childX[51] = 65; rsinterface.childY[51] = 160;
rsinterface.children[52] = 4106; rsinterface.childX[52] = 20; rsinterface.childY[52] = 180;
rsinterface.children[53] = 8671; rsinterface.childX[53] = 130; rsinterface.childY[53] = 160;
rsinterface.children[54] = 4142; rsinterface.childX[54] = 20; rsinterface.childY[54] = 180;
rsinterface.children[55] = 8672; rsinterface.childX[55] = 0; rsinterface.childY[55] = 190;
rsinterface.children[56] = 4160; rsinterface.childX[56] = 20; rsinterface.childY[56] = 150;
rsinterface.children[57] = 4160; rsinterface.childX[57] = 20; rsinterface.childY[57] = 150;
rsinterface.children[58] = 12162; rsinterface.childX[58] = 65; rsinterface.childY[58] = 190;
rsinterface.children[59] = 2832; rsinterface.childX[59] = 20; rsinterface.childY[59] = 150;
rsinterface.children[60] = 13928; rsinterface.childX[60] = 130; rsinterface.childY[60] = 190;
rsinterface.children[61] = 13917; rsinterface.childX[61] = 20; rsinterface.childY[61] = 150;
rsinterface.children[62] = 13984; rsinterface.childX[62] = 145; rsinterface.childY[62] = 225;
}

    public static void skillInterface(int i, int j){
            RSInterface rsinterface = interfaceCache[i] = new RSInterface();
            rsinterface.id = i;
            rsinterface.parentID = i;
            rsinterface.type = 5;
            rsinterface.atActionType = 0;
            rsinterface.contentType = 0;
            rsinterface.width = 26;
            rsinterface.height = 34;
            rsinterface.opacity = 0;
            rsinterface.mOverInterToTrigger = 0;
            rsinterface.sprite1 = imageLoader(j, "Skill/Skill");
            rsinterface.sprite2 = imageLoader(j, "Skill/Skill");
    }[/code]

I see nothing wrong with the skill interface just from a quick glance I would suggest looking at the tooltips.

This is silly why don’t you find the sprite name in the cache name and just do a search for that name in the client…

Read full topic
